intro: Avoira sylvestris, commonly known as the wild avoira, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Avoiraceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
